yacx

Class LongArg

  • java.lang.Object
    • yacx.JNIHandle
      • yacx.KernelArg
        • yacx.ArrayArg
          • yacx.LongArg

  • public class LongArg
extends ArrayArg
    Class representing an long-array-argument for the kernel.
    Note: The size in bytes for one long-element is fixed and may differ from the size of the corresponding data-type in CUDA, which is depending on your system. So make sure the size of the corresponding data-type is matching SIZE_BYTES to avoid unexpected segmentation faults.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static long SIZE_BYTES
      Size in bytes for one element.

      • create

        public static LongArg create(long[] longs,
                             boolean download)
        Create a new LongArg with the passed values.
        This argument will be uploaded. The argument will be downloaded when download is true.
        Parameters:
        longs - values for this argument
        download - set whether the argument should be downloaded
        Returns:
        a new LongArg with the passes values

      • createOutput

        public static LongArg createOutput(int length)
        Create an output-argument, which will be downloaded but not be uploaded.
        This argument will be allocating enough memory for length long-elements.
        Parameters:
        length - number of elements for the output-argument
        Returns:
        a new LongArg

      • slice

        public LongArg slice(int start,
                     int end)
        Description copied from class: ArrayArg
        Slices the array.
        This creates a new ArrayArg corresponding to a new C-KernelArg-Object, but using the same memory for the array.
        If the content of this ArrayArg changed, the content of the created ArrayArg will be changed too. In the other direction as well.
        Specified by:
        slice in class ArrayArg
        Parameters:
        start - index of the first element for the new array
        end - index of the last element for new array
        Returns:
        a new ArrayArg using the same memory for the array
